titleInfo.subTitle: George Matthes oral history interview, 1980

name.description: "Educated in engineering, George ""Red"" Matthes joined LSU's staff as the superintendent of buildings in 1929. In 1931, he became an engineering faculty member in addition to serving in campus purchasing and as the interim comptroller. In 1947 he became head of the Mechanical Engineering Department, where he remained until 1961. He continued as an engineering professor until his retirement in 1969."

mods.abstract: Matthes discusses his work with LSU's original architecture and landscaping, the move from the old downtown campus to LSU's present site, and construction of some campus buildings by the Works Progress Administration. He also reflects upon his time as a faculty member and as interim comptroller.
